importance: The chloroplasts of Vaucheria litorea are used by certain sacoglossan molluscs in kleptoplastic symbiosis. Plastid function and regulation in the alga and the animal is poorly understood.  Characterizing the transcriptome of this algal will aid in underst
primary_citation: Agardh, C.A. (1823). Species algarum rite congitae, com synonymis, differentiis specificis et descriptionibus succinctis. Volumen primum pars posterior.pp. [vii-viii],[300]-531. Luncae [Lund]: ex officina Berlingiana.
other_experimental_metadata_available: RNA will be pooled from algae grown under high, ambient and low light and collected from time points spanning the diurnal cycle.
modifications_to_growth_medium: Final molar concentration of vitamins as follows: Thiamine - HCl =1.184E-07M; Biotin=1.60E-07M; Vitamin B12=2.95E-08M
